casebody.data:
Debra Taylor JOHNSON, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. STEIN MART, INC., Defendant-Appellee. No. 07-13338. United States Court of Appeals, Eleventh Circuit. May 5, 2008. Richard E. Johnson, Law Office of Richard E. Johnson, Tallahassee, FL, for Plaintiff-Appellant. Kevin E. Hyde, Ernst A. Bell, Foley & Lardner, LLP, Jacksonville, FL, for Defendant-Appellee.

Before BIRCH, DUBINA and HILL, Circuit Judges.

*932PER CURIAM:

Having carefully considered the record, the briefs of the parties, and having heard oral argument, we VACATE and REMAND to allow the district court to complete the record. The district court should be guided by our prior decision in Snook v. Trust Co. of Ga. Bank of Savannah, N.A., 859 F.2d 865 (11th Cir.1988). Appellant’s Motion to Certify Question to Florida Supreme Court is therefore DENIED.
